resources.string: This feature requires that you have internet connectivity enabled.
Your GPS module is disabled. This feature requires GPS to be enabled, please do so now.
There was an error initializing the YouTubeThumbnailView (%1$s)
There was an error initializing the YouTubePlayer (%1$s)

This app records a user\'s runs with GPS and uses this information to class their ability and give them the necessary information to improve their running ability. Information is provided by Pat Divilly, a professional fitness instructor from Galway.
This project is forked from the GPL Licensed Open GPS Tracker hosted at https://code.google.com/p/open-gpstracker/. The authors put a lot of work into this project which is greatly appreciated.
Searching, get going and we will tell you when recording starts.
Note: Keep your finger on run below for more options.
Are you sure you want to delete this run?
How do you want to share?
I just ran %1$s in %2$s with Pat Divilly\'s Run Coach.
Watch this video for a guide on how to stretch before your run.
Welcome to Pat Divilly\'s Run Coach. We recommend you visit the getting started page.
If you enjoy using %1$s, please take a moment to rate it. Thanks for your support!
Google Play will be launched, once the app is on the market.

For the Newbies, I got together with some top runners and triathletes to outline a 3 week plan to get you started. 21 days from now you will run your first 5km. This plan is available in the coach section of the app.
For the more experienced runners, we\'ve set targets for to help you surpass your running goals. These goals can be seen in the coach section of the app.

Running is one of the most basic forms of exercise, but without the right information and guidance, many of us struggle to find our stride. This app was designed to help you reach your running goals, however big or small. So grab some running shoes and follow our step-by-step training guide to discover just what you can do.

Using your phones GPS functionality, you can track your runs and receive feedback. During the run you will hear a beep every kilometer and time feedback at significant distances. After the run feedback will be provided in the form of bronze, silver and gold medals which will help motivate you to keep improving.
This plan will guide runners to reach a goal of running a 5km race after just 21 days.
After 5 minutes of walking warm-up, alternate 5 minute jogs with 3 minutes walking. Repeat and finish with 4 minutes walk, then stretch.
After 5 minutes walking warm-up, jog for 10 minutes then walk 2 mins, repeatedly, until finished.
Stretch after a hot bath to keep your muscles supple.
After 5 minutes walking warm-up, jog for 13 minutes and walk 2 minutes then repeat.
After 3 minutes walking warm-up, jog 10 minutes with 2 minutes walk and repeat twice.
After 5 minutes walking, jog 16 minutes and finish with 4 minutes walk, then stretch.
After 3 minutes walking, jog for 15 minutes, then 2 mins brisk walk followed by 10 minutes jog and finish with five minutes walking.
After 3 minutes walking, jog for 20 minutes with 2 minutes walking, then a 10 minute jog and finish with five minutes walking.
After 4 minutes walking, jog 20 minutes with 3 minutes brisk walk, then repeat.
After 4 minutes walking, jog 14 minutes then 2 minutes walking and repeat. Finish with 4 minutes walk and stretch.
After 5 minutes walking, jog for 25 minutes, then 5 minutes brisk walk followed by 20 minutes jog and finish with 5 minutes walking.
After 3 minutes walking, jog for 30 minutes then walk until finished allotted time.
This times should provide you with good targets, however, please note that these times are highly variable depending on; age, weight, sex, baseline fitness level and running experience.
